text: right Rosie’s Place is a sanctuary for poor and homeless women located in Boston, Massachusetts. == History == It was founded in 1974 by Kip Tiernan as the first shelter specifically for homeless women in the United States. It has evolved from providing meals and shelter to creating permanent solutions through advocacy, education and affordable housing. Rosie's Place relies solely on the generous support of individuals, foundations and corporations and does not accept any city, state or federal funding. ==References== ==External links== * Rosie's Place website Category:Women in Massachusetts Category:Women's shelters in the United States Category:Homeless shelters in the United States Category:Homelessness organizations Category:Organizations based in Boston Category:Organizations established in 1974 Category:South End, Boston
title: Rosie's Place
